oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Clarksville Female Academy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Engraving of the Clarksville Female Academy showing several women walking on a path around the outside of the building.

The Clarksville Female Academy was organized in 1846 as the first girls' school in the area. During the Civil War, it was used by the Federal troops as a hospital. The school re-opened in 1866 after the building was repaired. In 1882 the original building was replaced.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Buttre, John Chester, 1821-1893
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Women--Education; Women--Education--History; Education--Tennessee
